bugs.title: CVE-2024-25629 c-ares: Out of bounds read in ares__read_line() [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-25629 c-ares: Out of bounds read in ares__read_line() [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-25629 c-ares: Out of bounds read in ares__read_line()

long_desc.thetext:
c-ares is a C library for asynchronous DNS requests. `ares__read_line()` is used to parse local configuration files such as `/etc/resolv.conf`, `/etc/nsswitch.conf`, the `HOSTALIASES` file, and if using a c-ares version prior to 1.27.0, the `/etc/hosts` file. If any of these configuration files has an embedded `NULL` character as the first character in a new line, it can lead to attempting to read memory prior to the start of the given buffer which may result in a crash. This issue is fixed in c-ares 1.27.0. No known workarounds exist.

https://github.com/c-ares/c-ares/commit/a804c04ddc8245fc8adf0e92368709639125e183
https://github.com/c-ares/c-ares/security/advisories/GHSA-mg26-v6qh-x48q

Created c-ares tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2265714]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2265713

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=low

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2265713,2265714

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

This update's test gating status has been changed to 'waiting'.
This update has obsoleted [c-ares-1.28.0-1.fc39](https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-290acd02c4), and has inherited its bugs and notes.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'failed'.

notes:
1.28.1 fixes a significant bug in 1.28.0.
